channel.title: Solar Ratios - Driving me fucking nuts!
channel.description:
You've been assigned to help build a model of the solar system for a local park. Your job is to figure out how far from the sun to place the plants. Here's some useful information:
Distance from Sun to Each Planet
Mercury - 36m mi Venus - 67m mi Earth - 93m mi Mars - 141m mi Jupiter - 483.3m mi Saturn - 886.4m mi Uranus - 1.796b mi Neptune - 2.794b mi Pluto - 3.660b mi
Since the sculptor wants the Earth to be 10 ft from the sun, you need to convert the planet distances into Earth units and then multiply by 10.
Earth units = [u]planets distance from the sun[/u] Earth's distance from the sun
Earth units for Mercury = 36,000,000 miles = 0.387 93,000,000 miles
Mercury's distance in model = 0.387 X 10 = 3.87 feet
Complete the table.
And then it just shows a table where I have to list the distance in earth units and distance in model for:
Mars Venus Earth Mars Jupiter Saturn Uranus Neptune Pluto
HELP!

item.title: Solar Ratios - Driving me fucking nuts!

item.title: Solar Ratios - Driving me fucking nuts!
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Why do you need help? The instructions on how to complete the problem are already given.

Perhaps a simpler explanation…Use “cross multiply and divide”

10 x
— = —
93m 36m

10 * 36 / 93 would give you “x”, which is Mercury’s distance from the Sun, in feet.

Read full topic
item.source: Solar Ratios - Driving me fucking nuts!

You’ve been assigned to help build a model of the solar system for a local park. Your job is to figure out how far from the sun to place the plants. Here’s some useful information:

Distance from Sun to Each Planet

Mercury - 36m mi
Venus - 67m mi
Earth - 93m mi
Mars - 141m mi
Jupiter - 483.3m mi
Saturn - 886.4m mi
Uranus - 1.796b mi
Neptune - 2.794b mi
Pluto - 3.660b mi

Since the sculptor wants the Earth to be 10 ft from the sun, you need to convert the planet distances into Earth units and then multiply by 10.

Earth units = planets distance from the sun
Earth’s distance from the sun

Earth units for Mercury = 36,000,000 miles
= 0.387
93,000,000 miles

Mercury’s distance in model = 0.387 X 10 = 3.87 feet

Complete the table.

And then it just shows a table where I have to list the distance in earth units and distance in model for:

Earth
